chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> distinct_parity m n -> rel_prime (Z.add m n) (Z.sub n m)

Premises:
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
distinct_parity = fun a b : Z => Zeven a /\ Zodd b \/ Zodd a /\ Zeven b : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments distinct_parity (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
prop2 : forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> rel_prime (m * m) (n * n)
relp_sum : forall m n : Z, rel_prime (m + n) (m - n) -> rel_prime m n
Z.divide_antisym : forall n m : Z, (n | m) -> (m | n) -> n = m \/ n = - m
relp_neq : forall m n : Z, m <> 1 -> m <> -1 -> rel_prime m n -> m <> n
prime_dec_aux : forall p m : Z, {forall n : Z, 1 < n < m -> rel_prime n p} + {exists n : Z, 1 < n < m /\ ~ rel_prime n p}
Z.divide_mul_l : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | m * p)
Z.divide_add_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m + p)
Z.divide_sub_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m - p)
Z.lt_le_incl : forall n m : Z, n < m -> n <= m
Z.ge_le : forall n m : Z, n >= m -> m <= n
Z.gt_lt : forall n m : Z, n > m -> m < n
Z.lt_gt : forall n m : Z, n < m -> m > n
Z.divide_factor_r : forall n m : Z, (n | m * n)
Z.le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Z.lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
Znot_gt_le : forall n m : Z, ~ n > m -> n <= m
Zlt_succ_le : forall n m : Z, n < Z.succ m -> n <= m
Zlt_le_succ : forall n m : Z, n < m -> Z.succ n <= m
Zgt_asym : forall n m : Z, n > m -> ~ m > n
Zle_not_lt : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> ~ m < n
Z.lt_lt_succ_r : forall n m : Z, n < m -> n < Z.succ m
Zmult_lt_0_reg_r : forall n m : Z, 0 < n -> 0 < m * n -> 0 < m
Zegal_left : forall n m : Z, n = m -> n + - m = 0
Zle_left : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> 0 <= m + - n
Z.opp_sub_distr : forall n m : Z, - (n - m) = - n + m
Z.mul_reg_l : forall n m p : Z, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m -> n = m
Zmult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> 0 <= p -> n * p <= m * p
Z.mul_reg_r : forall n m p : Z, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p -> n = m
Zminus_plus_simpl_l : forall n m p : Z, p + n - (p + m) = n - m
Zminus_plus_simpl_l_reverse : forall n m p : Z, n - m = p + n - (p + m)

```coq
intros m n rel_prime_mn distinct_parity_mn.
destruct distinct_parity_mn as [[even_m odd_n] | [odd_m even_n]].
- apply relp_sum.
  apply rel_prime_mn.
- apply relp_sum.
  apply rel_prime_mn.
Qed.
```
